data.title: Top technician warns these three hot tech stocks are bracing for a big pullback
data.text: Louise Yamada, Louise Yamada Technical Research Advisors, on watching key levels for tech. With CNBC's Melissa Lee and the Fast Money traders, Guy Adami, Tim Seymour, Karen Finerman and Bonawyn Eison.

data.title: Airbnb's IPO filing suggests it could spend at least $1.2 billion with Amazon Web Services over the next 5 years (AMZN)
data.text: Airbnb publicly revealed its paperwork for an initial public offering on Monday, revealing the company has a contract with a "data hosting services provider" to spend at least $1.2 billion by 2027. While the filing doesn't explicitly disclose the name of the data hosting services provider in question, it reads elsewhere that Airbnb relies "primarily" on Amazon Web Services for cloud computing services to host and deliver the company's platform. Indeed, the company has been a heavy AWS user since early in its existence.

data.title: Cyclical stocks may be racing higher, but tech is still expected to be a long-term winner
data.text: FANG stocks may be lagging, but don't count technology stocks out.

data.title: Here's how the Biden administration could shape Big Tech regulation
data.text: Kara Swisher, Recode executive editor, joins "Squawk Alley" to discuss how Big Tech could face regulation under president-elect Biden's administration.

data.title: Amazon Live Video Shows Us The Future Of Ecommerce
data.text: Live video will play a significant role in online shopping going forward. Marketers and influencers alike in the US have embraced the medium, of which Amazon is currently kingmaker.

data.title: Amazon Expands In-Garage Delivery to 4,000 Cities
data.text: It's a secure option for package delivery just in time for the holidays.
